node.title: Historic Jackson Heights or Astoria Waterfront? A Chicago Transplant Considers Queens.
node.alt: Linda Hughey Holt near her new Queens apartment. Dr. Holt was initially intent on buying a two-family house to make some rental income, but her daughters convinced her that she didn’t want to be a landlord. Instead, she looked for a two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment for up to $850,000. “I’ve been stalking New York real estate for years,” she said.
node.description: When two of her children landed in New York City, a Midwestern doctor took her $850,000 budget to Queens for a two-bedroom apartment close by. Which one would you choose?
